New Records: India awarded two debut caps for the match, with fast bowler Mayank Yadav and all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy making their first international appearance.
Key Match Events: After bowling out Bangladesh for 127, India raced home in 11.5 overs for a seven-wicket win to take a 1-0 lead in the three-match series.
Pre-Game Insights: Basit was particularly in awe of India's back-up strength, saying the team of young Indian Premier League (IPL) stars led by Suryakumar Yadav made Bangladesh look like an 'appetizer'.
Post-Match Reflections: 'Mayank, (Mohammed) Shami, (Jasprit) Bumrah, (Mohammed) Siraj -- four pacers. Banaye Australia bouncy wicket, phir pata chalega (let them prepare bouncy pitches and find out),' said Basit.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The T20I retirement of Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and Ravindra Jadeja has thrown open spots in the playing XI.
Others: Why did Suryakumar Yadav opt to bowl after winning the toss? Basit wondered. 'They should have batted on that 200-run flat track. I don't think they will make that mistake in the second match.'
